name: Homemade Curd (Yogurt)
history: Curd, also known as yogurt, has been a staple in many cultures worldwide for centuries. It is made through the bacterial fermentation of milk, a process that dates back to around 5000 BC. Curd is valued for its creamy texture and health benefits.
description: Homemade curd is a simple and nutritious dairy product made by fermenting milk with a curd culture or existing yogurt. The fermentation process thickens the milk and gives it a tangy flavor. It is often used in various cuisines or consumed directly.

instructions.title: Heat the Milk
instructions.description: Heat the milk in a saucepan until it is lukewarm, not boiling. Remove from heat.

instructions.title: Add Curd Culture
instructions.description: Add the curd culture or existing yogurt to the milk and mix well.

instructions.title: Set the Curd
instructions.description: Transfer the mixture to a container. Cover it and keep it in a warm place for 6-8 hours or overnight until the curd is set.

instructions.title: Refrigerate and Serve
instructions.description: Once set, refrigerate the curd to stop further souring. Serve chilled as desired.

tips: The temperature of the milk is crucial; too hot or too cold can prevent setting.
Use a heavy container to retain the warmth needed for setting.
variations: Add fruit or honey for a sweet version.
For thicker curd, use full-fat milk.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 1 week.
storage.instructions: Store in a closed container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a bowl with a drizzle of honey or fruit toppings.
Garnish with mint leaves or nuts for added flavor.
